comment.body:
It's actually been happening for ages, nothing recent, probably over a year, every time I use Google on either Safari or Firefox, and never in private tabs (as that would disable all extensions in Firefox).  I figured, and was hoping that AG would fix it since it's obvious and critical.  It is not occurring w/ AG on my iPhone though, which I tested now for the first time.

It's probably one of the filters or settings then.  Any suggestions on which ones to disable?

issue.title: www.masutabe.info

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://www.masutabe.info/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masutabe.info%2F) ### Comment > The problem arises because Adguard on iPhone struggles to manage iframes effectively. It lacks a specific rule to conceal the space reserved for advertisements. While on a PC, disabling the script reduces the space to zero, the scenario differs on an iPhone. Due to the persistence of the iframe, it's expected that the advertisement frame remains visible. If there's any other reason for this issue, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/c0o3dekmm94owkk0cwcw8s8sw088800qgbx2npk0ao.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/n96vm6q1shwkww0gowo0g4cc0o0g8oogpticg2iqsg.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: logs-partners.coupang.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

`ad-shield.io` native ads solution is displaying coupang(korean commerce)'s ads and tracking users prefer items.

it looks like a same way into `criteo`

### Proposed solution

add `logs-partners.coupang.com`, `ads-partners.coupang.com` domain in `ko-KR` filters

### Additional information

![Honeycam 2024-03-27 04-55-13](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/2796198/f8855c86-5780-448f-8fb6-e5bc28e8cbd9)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: ameblo.jp

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://ameblo.jp/tsuji-nozomi/entry-12845300483.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fameblo.jp%2Ftsuji-nozomi%2Fentry-12845300483.html) ### Comment > The issue I want to report in my GitHub post is that elements are not disappearing when displayed as "none". I am unable to determine the cause of this issue. Here are four possible reasons: > Adguard for iOS bug: Adguard for iOS is known to cause issues during rule updates. Attempting to resolve this issue involves updating rules, deleting caches, restarting the iPhone, and so on, without success. It has been an ongoing problem for years and has become a nuisance. Apple is the root of all evil. > Rule compilation? I think this may be the issue, but I'm not sure. > > Possibility that the optimized version has not been incorporated: I don't understand why the element is not invisible. Perhaps it is because it is no longer popular or because the rule is excluded. > > Possibility that too many rules have caused the issue: iOS 1.7 has rule limitations due to bugs, which may include additional rules that were removed from the optimization. > > Possibility that the rules are too old: The rules may be very old, and simply changing the web site may cause them to stop working. > > Below is the URL where I uploaded the html for Windows Chrome and iPhone. > Also, the first and second images are from iPhone, and the third and fourth are from Chrome. > > win - https://krakenfiles.com/view/M8KXkbU5wy/file.html > ios - https://krakenfiles.com/view/eO3TLVoD7w/file.html > > > I would appreciate any help in resolving this issue. Thank you. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/s4c2t3zyhcgcgcssc4kgcokskkg4gsko32ywb8bxo0.jpg?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://ameblo.jp/tsuji-nozomi/entry-12845300483.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fameblo.jp%2Ftsuji-nozomi%2Fentry-12845300483.html) ### Comment > The issue I want to report in my GitHub post is that elements are not disappearing when displayed as "none". I am unable to determine the cause of this issue. Here are four possible reasons: > Adguard for iOS bug: Adguard for iOS is known to cause issues during rule updates. Attempting to resolve this issue involves updating rules, deleting caches, restarting the iPhone, and so on, without success. It has been an ongoing problem for years and has become a nuisance. Apple is the root of all evil. > Rule compilation? I think this may be the issue, but I'm not sure. > > Possibility that the optimized version has not been incorporated: I don't understand why the element is not invisible. Perhaps it is because it is no longer popular or because the rule is excluded. > > Possibility that too many rules have caused the issue: iOS 1.7 has rule limitations due to bugs, which may include additional rules that were removed from the optimization. > > Possibility that the rules are too old: The rules may be very old, and simply changing the web site may cause them to stop working. > > Below is the URL where I uploaded the html for Windows Chrome and iPhone. > Also, the first and second images are from iPhone, and the third and fourth are from Chrome. > > win - https://krakenfiles.com/view/M8KXkbU5wy/file.html > ios - https://krakenfiles.com/view/eO3TLVoD7w/file.html > > > I would appreciate any help in resolving this issue. Thank you. ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://www.masutabe.info/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masutabe.info%2F) ### Comment > The problem arises because Adguard on iPhone struggles to manage iframes effectively. It lacks a specific rule to conceal the space reserved for advertisements. While on a PC, disabling the script reduces the space to zero, the scenario differs on an iPhone. Due to the persistence of the iframe, it's expected that the advertisement frame remains visible. If there's any other reason for this issue, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/c0o3dekmm94owkk0cwcw8s8sw088800qgbx2npk0ao.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/n96vm6q1shwkww0gowo0g4cc0o0g8oogpticg2iqsg.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules in AnnoyancesFilter (MobileApp)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are multiple duplicate rules present in the filters.
```
###app
###body-fixed-footer
###downloadApp
###win_appinstallhint
##.app-modal
##.footer-app
##.fpage > div.ftitle + noindex
##.mobile-app-widget
##.open-with-app
##.p-footer-wego-app
##.smart-banner
##a[title="Pokebattler Raid Party App"]
##alliance-shared-app-promo-banner
##div[data-qa="app-smartbanner"]
##smartbanner.android { display: none!important; }
```

### Proposed solution

Remove redundant rules or merge multiple rules into a single rule where possible.

### Additional information

These rules are grouped by domain or some rules have sections in different locations. So I was unable to determine whether I should merge the rules. 
If necessary, please merge them on the maintainer side.
Here are examples of such rules:

`###bosaiapp`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L333
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L3280

`###download`

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L3212

`###js-appeal-top-banner`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L449

`##.InstallAppAllStore`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L395

`##.extension-container`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L3253

`##.open-in-app`

`##div[jsaction*="promotion"]`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L318

`##app-layer-customer-notification-centered-sheet-dialog { display: none !important; }`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L700

`##smartbanner { display: none !important; }`
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L877
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/ef911a41f5102dc86ac78f17ba275417fd1fe30e/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections/mobile-app_specific.txt#L3266

I will create a pull request for now, but if it's unnecessary, please feel free to close it. If that's the case, a brief comment would be appreciated.
If the pull request is unnecessary, I'm considering creating only similar issues in the future. If issues are also unnecessary, please let me know at that time as well.
In that case, I will either send the list of duplicate rules for each filter that I have already extracted via e-mail or list up them in a single issue. 
Thank you.

comment.body: In a same file rules can be merged (if no special separation by comments or directives)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.utstyrsbutikken.no/products/batteriadapter-aaa-til-aa](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.utstyrsbutikken.no%2Fproducts%2Fbatteriadapter-aaa-til-aa) ### Comment > Cookie sticky banner on bottom. I propose: > ``` > ##.consent_container:not(body,html,:empty) > /css/modules/consent.css^$~third-party > ``` > I notice that `##.consent-container` with a dash is already in the list, so adding it as a generic entry with an underscore I presume would go well enough. > > https://github.com/OhMyGuus/I-Still-Dont-Care-About-Cookies/issues seem overwhelmed to the point of de facto collapse, so it seems I'll be submitting cookie banners to AdGuard Filters too nowadays.

Username: `@DandelionSprout` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://ameblo.jp/tsuji-nozomi/entry-12845300483.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fameblo.jp%2Ftsuji-nozomi%2Fentry-12845300483.html) ### Comment > The issue I want to report in my GitHub post is that elements are not disappearing when displayed as "none". I am unable to determine the cause of this issue. Here are four possible reasons: > Adguard for iOS bug: Adguard for iOS is known to cause issues during rule updates. Attempting to resolve this issue involves updating rules, deleting caches, restarting the iPhone, and so on, without success. It has been an ongoing problem for years and has become a nuisance. Apple is the root of all evil. > Rule compilation? I think this may be the issue, but I'm not sure. > > Possibility that the optimized version has not been incorporated: I don't understand why the element is not invisible. Perhaps it is because it is no longer popular or because the rule is excluded. > > Possibility that too many rules have caused the issue: iOS 1.7 has rule limitations due to bugs, which may include additional rules that were removed from the optimization. > > Possibility that the rules are too old: The rules may be very old, and simply changing the web site may cause them to stop working. > > Below is the URL where I uploaded the html for Windows Chrome and iPhone. > Also, the first and second images are from iPhone, and the third and fourth are from Chrome. > > win - https://krakenfiles.com/view/M8KXkbU5wy/file.html > ios - https://krakenfiles.com/view/eO3TLVoD7w/file.html > > > I would appreciate any help in resolving this issue. comment.body:
No, I cannot.
Usually there is visible notice that ad is playing (like in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/174893#issuecomment-1998861463) and I don't see anything like that on mentioned podcasts.
Ads between songs are automatically skipped after 1 second by this rule:
```adblock
||audio-ak*-spotify-com.akamaized.net/audio/$media,~xmlhttprequest,redirect=noopmp4-1s,domain=spotify.com
```
on my end.

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://www.channel5.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.channel5.com)
### Comment
> The below applies when using ONLY Adguard DNS (i.e., no Adguard Extension). A fix would be appreciated for devices unable to install extensions or the full Adguard application.
> 
> When watching non-live programme/movie, a black screen shows for approximately 35 seconds before it begins. The same happens during the programme/movie when designated ad break slots are meant to appear.
> 
> The page appears to be attempting to load the ads, however after approximately 35 gives up and plays the programme/film without them.
> 
> This does not effect Live TV.
> 
> This does NOT effect the My5 Android/iOS/tvOS apps - they block ads correctly without pause. Please do not break this to fix the above (as the issue above only happens within browsers using ONLY Adguard DNS).
> 
> Thank you.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

issue.title: www.channel5.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://www.channel5.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.channel5.com)
### Comment
> The below applies when using ONLY Adguard DNS (i.e., no Adguard Extension). A fix would be appreciated for devices unable to install extensions or the full Adguard application.
> 
> When watching non-live programme/movie, a black screen shows for approximately 35 seconds before it begins. The same happens during the programme/movie when designated ad break slots are meant to appear.
> 
> The page appears to be attempting to load the ads, however after approximately 35 gives up and plays the programme/film without them.
> 
> This does not effect Live TV.
> 
> This does NOT effect the My5 Android/iOS/tvOS apps - they block ads correctly without pause. Please do not break this to fix the above (as the issue above only happens within browsers using ONLY Adguard DNS).
> 
> Thank you.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
But why `!adguard_ext_safari`?
`header` can't be used in Safari and with CB for Android
https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#basic-rules-basic-modifiers

So can be changed to use only in AdGuard for Safari/iOS and CB for Android.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://www.channel5.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.channel5.com)
### Comment
> The below applies when using ONLY Adguard DNS (i.e., no Adguard Extension). A fix would be appreciated for devices unable to install extensions or the full Adguard application.
> 
> When watching non-live programme/movie, a black screen shows for approximately 35 seconds before it begins. The same happens during the programme/movie when designated ad break slots are meant to appear.
> 
> The page appears to be attempting to load the ads, however after approximately 35 gives up and plays the programme/film without them.
> 
> This does not effect Live TV.
> 
> This does NOT effect the My5 Android/iOS/tvOS apps - they block ads correctly without pause. Please do not break this to fix the above (as the issue above only happens within browsers using ONLY Adguard DNS).
> 
> Thank you.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

commits.message:
Update GitHub workflows to Node v20 (#174694)

* update linter workflows

* bump actions script to v7

* bump actions stale to v9

* update workspace recommendations

* add expression markers

comment.body:
@DandelionSprout Hi. Is it still required?
https://github.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/blob/4b95674f1ec52d5db5a288e19abaef5a735c3628/NorwegianExperimentalList%20alternate%20versions/NordicFiltersABP.txt#L2056

It seems `||gamer.no/663b80169e8ee83b03ce77346eb832ba` or `gamer.no#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'ads', 'emptyObj')` is enough.

These rules work on my end
```adblock
gamer.no#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'ads', 'emptyObj')
gamer.no##.container > div[class]:has(> [data-size-mapping="toppbanner"])
gamer.no##header ~ * > [class]:has(> [data-name="gamer_toppbanner"])
gamer.no##.fullscreen-ad
```

comment.body: @Alex-302 Yes, but any URL with tiktokcounter in it means that you're not there yet. You still have to get through that, and that's what people are trying to do whenever they bring this up. Tiktokcounter is the speedbump before whatever the content that the user went there for wants to get at. To be clear, the above is just a generic example. I don't actually know if there's anything beyond all the tiktokcounter screens in this particular case.

`###shoper-foot ~ div.consents` is applied on my end too (as far as I can see, it was added today in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/322768a0ad7a91be5fe8576ba6dd9fce5d3ec30c), but `##.shop_index > div.consents` is applied only on the main page - `https://r-kom.pl/`, but not on - `https://r-kom.pl/pl/p/SAMSUNG-GALAXY-S23-ULTRA-5G-S918BDS-12512GB-DUAL-SIM-GREEN/441`

comment.body:
@shape55 As I remember, ad blockers doesn't affect the appearance of tracking links. But I see them only in search ads, not in the results.
That's the problem with links like this, right? Nothing broken?


We can remove some query parameters, but you will see redirection consent
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/8361299/2589583e-6534-480f-9ba4-d56b4fb3fbde)

For user rules:

```adblock
||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?$removeparam=gclid
||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?$removeparam=cid
||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?$removeparam=sig
||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?$removeparam=ved
```

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Sure, avoid when possible, but at least one of my favorite sites has started using it and I don't know of a replacement yet.

But on what you're saying about it working, I'm not sure what you mean by that since you're showing what it looks like when it' s not. Like, for example:

`https://ctr.sh/xawKp`

When clicked, it'll get through the redirection and plunk you down on a page like what you showed. And then you have to get through all of that. Maybe I misunderstood, but I thought the goal was to bypass _that_ stuff  in order to get to whatever is beyond it.
